item.title: Darkest Dark for Authentic Souls.
item.dc:creator: Wanda Muriy
item.description:
If you are not fashion-challenged in the web development world and like to show your true colors, Darkest Dark theme is for you. Unlike the fake sense of self provided by Nordstrom’s mud-stained jeans, our theme appeals to your authentic developer’s identity, providing features that do make sense and allow you to work in a […]

item.title: Bugs for All to See
item.dc:creator: Wanda Muriy
item.description:
History doesn’t need to repeat itself: the Bubonic Plague doesn’t have to happen in the developers’ world in the XXI century. Your program’s “fleas” can be handled efficiently without causing your app to be gravely infected, and now you will be fully informed about every step we take to bring the remedy your way. Indeed, all […]

item.title: Angular 4 — the Butterfly, Not the Cocoon.
item.dc:creator: Wanda Muriy
item.description:
Metamorphosis doesn’t have to be ugly: forget about Kafka or what a butterfly has to go through before it shows its amazing apparel. Angular 4 has evolved for you and is showing its best colors. “Just how different is it from Angular 2?”, you might wonder. There are some overall and package-specific changes, as well […]

item.title: The Time Has Come to Learn TypeScript.
item.dc:creator: Wanda Muriy
item.description:
TypeScript or JavaScript?  Now, that is the question!  If TypeScript, a typed superset of JavaScript, compiles down to JavaScript, the obvious query is why have it in the first place.  Another logical inquiry is whether it’s ideal for everyone, how and where it can be used.There are two good reasons why developers should bother learning […]

item.title: MyEclipse 2017 Stable 1.0 is out!
item.dc:creator: Anabella
item.description:
Earlier this year we were really excited about being able to provide you with initial support for Angular 2. Well, now with this release you also get tooling support for Angular 4. Not only that, but we wanted to make sure you were able to update simply to Angular 4 — with a one-click flow […]

item.title: Upgrade to Angular 4 – Lost in Angular Migration?

item.title: Angular 4, TypeScript 2.2 & More, now in Webclipse CI 4!
item.dc:creator: Anabella
item.description:

item.title: Darkest Dark – Making it to the 4th most popular plugin in 30 Days
item.dc:creator: timwebb
item.description:

While other “cool” IDEs and Editors have built up their markets, Eclipse has looked about the same for the last decade. Many love that stability, but many others are ready for change. […]

item.title: Angular 4 Is Coming!
item.dc:creator: Wanda Muriy
item.description:
Good news for Angular 2 users — Angular 4, a backwards compatible upgrade, is around the corner!  It will offer further improvements without rewriting the entire framework, as was the case with Angular 2 in the switch from the first version (Minar, I.).  The main change has to do with alteration in certain core libraries […]
